title: Bad app, great machine
text:
The Blueair Classic 680i is a fantastic air cleaner. (albeit a very large unit) However, the app is lacking in numerous ways compared to competitors… 

 1) No Apple HomeKit integration 

 2) If you are an Apple user, you cannot add the device to your home automation scenes. (ie, automatically turn on when I arrive home and turn off when I leave home, etc) 

 3) No Home Screen widget to see current air quality stats 

 4) No integration with Siri Shortcuts app or commands. (they have this enabled for Alexa and Google, so they clearly are just ignoring Apple users) 

 5) The setup process to connect the device to your home WiFi is not intuitive and more cumbersome than other apps. It also does not support 5ghz WiFi. 

 6) The app requires your exact location, not a close location. That’s a huge privacy concern! Why do you need to know my exact location? Anywhere within a 1/2 mile is close enough for the outdoor air quality levels in the app. You don’t need my pinpoint location. 

 7) No notification options. Other apps send you a notification if AQI, PM2.5, VOC, etc goes over specified levels. Blueair sends me nothing. 

 8) No firmware update button in the app, so you cannot force it to check for updates. You have to wait until it decides to check on its own.

9) No way to save or export the weekly/monthly data.

This is a special complication when you need to confirm the presence of an indicator light on the machine from the app (a wrong answer will send you straight back to the beginning of setup).

Once the machine is setup the app is actually really interesting, giving real-time updates of air quality in your house and reacting quickly to your commands. 

Still, my machine only supports 1 WiFi band (2.4ghz), an increasingly obsolete band as we move into faster and faster wireless computing, which is yet another technical hoop to jump through. This app needs some updates but the operation is smooth if you can get to the core functions of the app, and there’s almost no reason to own the higher end machines if you can’t use the app for real time sensor information, imho.

As such, save the $70 and buy the non-i Series and a stand alone air quality monitor that gives you access to “your data” and doesn’t potentially compromise your security by phoning home with data.

title: Challenged App Developers Jeopardizing Future of Blueair
text:
Yep, there’s a reason this app has the absolute worst user rating in the App Store. Set up took an hour with each of my three air purifiers. After set up, the app was buggy and clunky, but at least controlled the devices. Then it stopped working. 
My home network map shows it’s connected, but I’ve lost any control of the devices. There’s no update function on the app, and all the usual tricks have not worked. Two thumbs down! Time to call China for a new app, you “Swedish” company you... maybe even time to manufacture the beautifully designed device yourself so you can regain quality control.

title: Nice visual update, needs HomeKit/Siri support
text:
Once they add HomeKit, there is no reason not to go with Blueair when buying a good air purifier. The app looks much better than the old one but I’m sure they will be working out a few bugs. I’d really like to see the time in AM/PM and not 24 hour military time when doing scheduling.

Overall though it’s an upgrade, and I think is easier to use. The visual air quality graphs are nice but I’m more into just being able to control my purifier manually. 

Can we expect HomeKit support someday?

title: Not User Friendly
text: I have never encountered an app that is so counterintuitive!  It has no explanations how to set up functions and have to contact them to see why it didn’t work. Filling out the form is another trial because it won’t submit and does not tell you what needs fixing. Every line is filled but it goes nowhere. I get on chat and again bland general statements. I insisted on step by Step explanation to try to understand the error. Oh- so many details were left out of the set up of the function. This is really frustrating. Still have other questions but then chat was dropped!

title: Terrible/Useless App
text: They make amazing air purifiers, but will not purchase another one until they fix their app issues. It’s plagued with bugs. There has been multiple updates in December of 2020, but you still can’t connect your product to the app. After putting in the WiFi password, the “connect” button does not work. They need to simplify the app, I don’t care about air quality in the app for my local neighbor. I can use weather apps for that. The developer really needs to fix their app, because they will loose me as a future customer if these app issues don’t get resolved.

title: Blueair App ***BROKEN***, can’t connect product.
text:
Blueair App is basically unusable for managing the hardware settings, WiFi settings and managing the Blueair units.

===> when adding a new product (I.e. Classic 205 Blueair, the “Setup my device” doesn’t work when you try to Connect a new product.  The button doesn’t do anything when you click on it. <===

There is no way to change the WiFi setting on the Blueair product.  The Setting function on the Blueair app basically doesn’t have any settings that you adjust.  The Blueair website and knowledge base doesn’t offer any info on how to change WiFi setting when you need to rename WiFi and password.

When the Blueair product loses WiFi and needs to be power cycled, the IOS App doesn’t sense that and continues thinking it is connected.  

Lastly, too much clutter on the App.  Population information, etc.  Blueair needs to focus on developing an App to manage the hardware and product first!!

title: Lazy
text:
The App is a joke.
The connection process is ham-handed and horribly lacking.  It wastes time scamming you into believing it may actually connect directly to your home WiFi when it will absolutely not.  I’ve had these filters for over 5 years and not one time have they connected to my home WiFi without going through a marginally effective manual connection process that takes repeated attempts to actually connect.
The customer service and responses are snippy, dismissive and decidedly indignant.  It is incredibly frustrating for such a good product to be negatively impacted because of lazy software development.

title: Useless
text: The old version of the blueair friend app was very useful. Both in determining the quality of the indoor air as well as the outdoor air. Also it allowed you the option of controlling connected blueair purifiers. However, the last several “ updates” have rendered the app useless. The information displayed referring to air quality is completely inaccurate. Even attempting to use it is very frustrating. The old app was accurate and easy to navigate. This makes it pointless to purchase the blueair aware air quality monitor as you can’t actually see any accurate values through the app.

title: Worst app on my phone
text:
First it took almost an hour to get a password set with their ridiculous requirements for passwords as if I’m securing Fort Knox instead of a fan in a box, that’s a major pain in the rear. Next, I’m unable to resister my air cleaner to receive the extended warranty because the text on the registration page is not at all legible so there’s no way to tell what to put where.
I’ve got half a mind to return the $600us  air cleaner (a fan in a box) because of this horrible app.  If they can’t create the simplest app that this product requires, can they be trusted to make a functioning, reliable air cleaner?

title: App Still Doesn’t Work
text:
Seemed unimaginable that such a good brand would have such a poor interface. I actually didn’t believe the reviews. 

First the app wouldn’t pair with the purifier. Then, with the help of technical support it finally paired. The support person was hopeful a new version of the app just been released would resolve many of the chronic issues. Unfortunately many of the control features and data display are non-existent!!!!! 

My issue was escalated to the next level of support two weeks ago but I have heard nothing. I simply want to turn off that blue LED and set the schedule so it doesn’t wake me at night. The support person (who actually tried to be very helpful but was not supplied the tools or knowledge to do so) actually suggested I put a piece of tape over the LED. 

The unit is quiet, but I am very unlikely to purchase another given the very ill equipped customer support. Seems to be a chronic failure here.

title: Broken scheduling feature
text: I own a Classic 580i. There is a serious bug when trying to schedule my air cleaner. The ability to choose a scheduled time is severely broken because the time picker does not display properly. The choice of times is obscured off the edge of the screen/window. This functionality is broken on both iPad (13.5) and iPhone (14.1), though in different ways. Please address this ASAP as using the app to schedule and control the cleaner is a core part of the premium attached to your Classic products.

title: Used to work... now doesn’t
text: I just moved to a new location and now can’t get my Blueair aware sensor to connect to the internet. I’ve tried the normal and manual protocols in every way I can think of. It will set up to my phone fine, but just says OFFLINE and the sensor blinks orange. The “contact support” page on the app is blank - doesn’t give me any option for contacting support. I’ve reached out via Facebook with no response and the support link on Apple store links to an insecure page with a warning. I’m hoping this wasn’t a huge waste of money and the company gives me some actual way to get in contact with tech support.

title: New app won’t work.
text: In 2020 I purchased 3 classic air purifiers from Blueair. With littke work I was able to connect my smart device to remotely control all of them, last year at purchase. 6 months later the company changed the app and none of my Blueair air purifiers will communicate with my modem-router. I have spent numerous hours trying to troubleshoot this problem. I’m really mad because I spent a lot of money on these air purifiers and replacement filters. I can no longer tell when the filter is dirty since the sensor and indicator light won’t reset with newly replaced filters. #BlueairPleaseFixThisIssue !

title: It’s gotten worse!
text: This update is much worse than the previous version. The only new piece of information is the level of PM 1, which is nice. The vertical scale of the data seems to be compressed. I can’t see any variation in the graph for any of the indoor sensor data. Also, I can find out how to display temperatures in Fahrenheit. Should be easy to fix ... The outdoor data does not seem to be correct. What is the source? It used to be breezometer. The time granularity now seems to be very coarse. Please consider improving! For now, I will try to revert to the previous version of the app, if possible.

title: App troubles
text: I had the same issues mentioned in other reviews with registering a device. I even tried on multiple devices without success. I deleted the app from my phone but then decided to try a few days later. I allowed bluetooth and it connected to my device right away. Only handy feature is changing device speed. I thought it had sensors to read air quality but turns out that’s only for select machines.

title: Very bad app update, not user friendly.
text: This is a complete opposite of what we saw on the previous app, which was useful, give it back! The main features to show air components change on the purifier by the time is soooo confusing and the chart is not clear, it’s just bland - like there is no change. And why the temp all of a sudden in C? I really don’t mind that, but it’s a big change from previous F. The color of the app is dark, I prefer it white and clear like an air that the air purifier clears. It’s a lot to get used to and I don’t know if I can use it as much. Please make another update.

title: Yeah... the app still doesn’t work
text:
Even though I am connected to the blue air Wi-Fi, the app keeps telling me to connect to it. I have tried everything.
I then see replies from the company that say the app was updated and the bugs were fixed... it’s just frustrating to see a company lie about this.

Btw I am a 25 year old college kid who has a ton of tech experience... it’s really just a problem with this app.

title: Nightmare app
text: This app is such a nightmare, both before and after the update. It’s almost impossible to connect it to the device. My husband and I tried it for hours and it just takes you in a loop of connecting with different flashing symbols and having to enter your WiFi password 20 times.  Then, in the one time we could get it connected, it doesn’t stay connected. Some nights I can adjust the device from my phone, other nights not. They need to get it together with this app especially given the purifier is SO expensive!

title: Pathetic.
text:
Auto setup didn’t work, tried it about three times. Then the manual config, that didn’t work either. Joined their config network and came back and hit Done, nothing happened.

Here’s my advice to companies like Unilever who are trying to get digital. If you can’t do it. Don’t. Just do what you do, and don’t try to get all modern. Sell reliable stuff. Don’t waste people’s time with half baked apps. I have lots of smart home stuff. This is the worst so far. 

I wish I would have read these abysmal reviews prior to buying the unit, which is going back, and your supplier is going to pay return shipping.

title: Disappointed
text: I’d give it no stars if I could! I can’t even get the app to connect to my purifier to see how it’s actually working. I called customer service and they took a message. Why bother answering the phone if you can’t help?!?!? I’ve tried all the connection tips, no luck. Interesting that there are so many instructions to troubleshoot their app - almost like they know it doesn’t work?!?!?! I can only assume the machine is actually doing what it’s supposed to do - it would be nice to be able to see the information instead of assuming!

title: Smooth but need more features
text: The app works smooth but that's it. Schedule function should be quite basic in current smart devices market but it doesn't have it. Night mode is quite confusing, what will it do after the night mode end? just turn off or resume back to the mode before night mode start? Also lacking of simple timer, ex: 1hr/3hr...etc. These are not diffifult feature if you already build a App could do wirelessly control.

title: Works Well For Me
text: Got the air cleaner on 7/3/20 and the app makes it relatively easy to connect to the machine. Easier than my Roomba app connection.  And the app functionalities are very useful and intuitive. Good job Blueair - from what I’ve heard from others the app was a disaster; you must have fixed the issues!

title: They make GREAT air purifiers but this app should go back to the drawing board
text:
1. I tried to create an account. I entered my email address, then it asked me to enter my password. I entered a password. It said that it was incorrect. Um... I was trying to create a password, how could it be incorrect? I tried 3 times. Same result.

title: Non functional App

Can we trust that the purifiers work as represented?

title: Buggy app - schedules offset by 1 hour for US customers
text: The app has a bug for HealthProtect 7470i air purifier customers in the US, where a schedule set to begin at 8:00 AM actually does not begin until 9:00 AM. title: Why Does it Turn Orange?
text: The BlueAir Aware is an affordable way to get an idea of air quality, but the app gives very little quantitative data to actually figure out how bad the air really is. For example, our unit turns orange sometimes, indicating pollution, but the PM2.5 is excellent and the VOCs are good to moderate according to the app. I’m guessing the carbon dioxide calculation is triggering the orange light, but that’s just a guess because the app doesn’t show that (it apparently used to).

title: Blueair App
text: I have never had a more difficult time connecting to an app.  I managed to do it with great difficulty when I first got the Classic filter after many tries.  If you lose a connection the best thing to do is disconnect the filter from power and plugging it back in after totally deleting the app from your iPhone and then reloading it and setting it up from scratch.  Start fresh!  I am a retired operations manager and IT director at a county of 550,000 residents and I understand software and how it should work.  Need I say more?

title: It works fine!
text: I don’t know what all these negative reviews are but the app is simple and functional. It looks nice and does everything you need it to do. Pretty sure the bad reviews are just spamming or literally they got a non-WiFi unit and are just confused.

title: Useless
text:

title: Connection is OK, fan speed is playing funny
text:
By reading a lot of bad app connection review online for the older model. I decide to go a newer model, 7710i.

Con: 
1. The google assistant integration like a joke, but since this feature is released recently and I hope it got improved.

I only owed this unit for 2 days and now I am thinking to return it...

title: Suddenly stopped working
text: I don’t know what’s going on. It all of a sudden all of my filtered are shown to be offline. I cannot control them from the app any longer. I have removed and reinstalled the app three times now and cannot get anything to reconnect. The help page on the website looks like it’s broken and I’m at a loss. This worked fine for about 5 months and now nothing works. Incredibly frustrating experience for such an expensive product.

title: love my blue air!!
text: I love this filter. I have the worst allergies. i now get shots for them, and this filter has helped me a ton. i have two cats (allergic to both) and it does a great job of cleaning the air in my room. I LOVE the new update - it’s so cool to see the air quality at your exact location. highly highly recommend

title: App is terrible!!
text: Where to begin.. the current status is almost always wrong as the date is incorrect and won’t show current day. The fan status and filter status is also out of sync.  When I bought this filter 8 months ago, the app worked well and was fairly reliable. After the update back in the summer, it stopped working and has been totally useless.  Great filter but useless if you are looking for app connectivity.

title: Latest Update Made it Worse
text:
Edit 11/28: App works perfectly now. 

App uploads automatically and now my aware and purifier will not connect. Deleted app and products and still the same error about not being able to connect to WiFi. Please find a new app designer and fix the issue!

title: Great start!  Needs more features
text:
This app is a great start. I have a model 205 purifier. I like the scheduling capability of Night Mode, but I'd really like to see a more robust 24/7 scheduler -- multiple 'run' periods per day, a periodic feature. I'd also like to see a one-button run for an hour or two feature. 

Finally, it's a bummer you can at least adjust fan speed via the watch app -- now, that would be cool!

title: App takes long to sync up with device
text: After finishing setup, the app kept showing the device is offline.  However it is NOT offline.  I can turn the device on and off. That confusion lead me to rerun the setup multiple times. Finally, I gave up and let it sit. After a while, the app finally sync up with the device.

title: Pathetic app = pathetic product?
text:
Yet another company that alienates and frustrates its customers by building a pathetic app. I’ve connected via Wi-Fi but the app keeps telling me to connect the product. When I go to the support area of the app to send a message it keeps booting me back to another part of the app. 

Either get your act together technically or don’t claim to have a Wi-Fi feature. By having pathetic connected technology you called into question your filtering technology.

title: The Ghost of Blue Air Sense
text: Was working fine on wifi for a few years but with the last update it is not. It ALWAY shows offline, but eirily, it sometimes keeps the schedule! Must be a ghost turning it on at night and then in the AM. I tried it all- uninstalling, unplugging, changing wifi, unsecured wifi, dancing about...but nothing changes to it say it is online. But yet it sometimes starts up at the proper time.  Oooo👻

title: Easy to use and great connectivity!
text: So happy that there is an app to go along with my blueair. The purifier has changed my life with mine and my husband's allergies and now I can connect to my Aware to see what the levels are like in my home. Easy to use and connect to our wifi. Love it!

title: Could not connect app to device.  I give up.
text: The app would not connect to the device over my WiFi.  It instructed to do so over an alternate network, said it was successful, then I return to the app which said it was not connected after all.  I did it a few times and the same thing occurred.  I like the Blueair device itself but this app is a disaster.  If someone buys the device expecting Wi-Fi functionality they should prepare to be disappointed.

title: Works great with 7440i
text: Can confirm other reviews, the 7000 series integration with the app is robust, easy to setup and reliable. One thing that still is unclear…it seems that the app needs to be open in order for the scheduled routines to be triggered…

title: Last update seems to have fixed most major bugs
text: The last update seems to have fixed the major bugs I’ve been experiencing. Still needs some polish, but this is an app that does what it is supposed to do.

title: Latest app is terrible
text: Previous versions your air purifiers were the focal point on the application. Now they are consigned to an after thought as the app defaults to showing North Atlantic Ocean weather. The main function of the latest app is to invade your privacy to grab as much identifying information as possible. You are forced to login and enable location services to control your air purifier. In addition the UI looks as if it time warped from the late 90’s.

title: Worst app I’ve ever used.
text: If you need to be able to control your devices via an application, I would strongly reconsider your choice to use BlueAir devices. The company has made it clear that they do not care about their devices working with an app. You’ll read through these reviews — like I did — and think, “these folks just aren’t tech savvy - I’m sure it’s not that bad.” A few days later you’ll be leaving a review just like this.

title: Good filter, useless app
text:
Honestly no app would be better than this. There is no real value in this app other than a fancy remote control. The default position of the air quality indicator is sometime last month and then you have to scroll to get to the present day. 

I think it is designed to get you to buy the next filter not to actually help you use the filter. You can only pair one device at time it seems.

title: Beautiful Product
text: This is a beautiful looking product (Health Protect 7770).  Fan speed 1 makes zero discernible sound. And despite what I read in other posts, the app setup was quick and easy. Awesome product!

title: Incorrect fan speed/filter life
text: App displays incorrect fan speed on the classic 605. It only displays correct fan speed if fan speed is adjusted in the app. If fan speed is changed via the schedule or on the machine control panel, the app displays incorrect fan speed. Also, filter life is listed at 9999 days and no longer displays correct information. This needs to be fixed.

title: Love it
text: I use this to check air during fire or smog season. Quick and easy, gives me details about what’s in the air. If we need to evacuate I can easily see where to go for clean air. Easy, useful and helpful.

title: Much Improved!
text: Revised app much improved, easy control of all 4 of my units sitting on the couch!  I have severe allergies and these units have made a huge difference.  Improvements to the app have helped tremendously!

title: Update needs an update
text: This update is ok except for the graphs.  Liked the previous version where I could pinch or stretch the timeline to get a better sense of how things are changing. Now the line looks too flat. I wish I could exaggerate the y axis to accentuate the changes. Otherwise I like the new look. So we lost the CO2 eq - it was pretty much the same as the tVOC line anyway.

title: Terrible app
text: It's really disappointing that this expensive well reviewed air filter comes with such a crappy expensive app that doesn't work. I've tried to communicate with customer service about this, but getting nothing but a run around. I don't think Blueair is ready for prime time when it comes to their app. I'd recommend getting the models that don't include the app. Just set it yourself manually. So disappointing.

title: Friends it isn’t
text: Current app is a major step backwards. The Aware can provide 3 pollutants and 2 functions you probably already have in you home with far less expensive instruments, temperature and humidity.  Now CO2 is no longer reported.  History has been reduced to a single graph rather than now, daily, weekly etc. until features of previous app are restored look for a different device.  Contrast is also poor on my smart phone.

title: Hate the new App
text:
The old app version was so much nicer. Here they have made it look better but made filter info summerised. Earlier Filter info was much better. Date installed. Health. 
This App is quite horrible, does not read the filters. I have 7 Blueair units on this (live in India) and now 3-4 constantly show offline while the filters show they’re online. 
Don’t like the new App. Give us the old one. It worked perfectly.

title: App update is the worst.
text: The new update is so cluttered and requires several steps to see VOC levels. Since the new update the VOC level has not really moved. It is stuck at polluted even though I have opened all windows and have used fans to air out the space. My VOC levels used to be excellent. All other readings have not moved either. Also,  I have not been able to receive notifications. The app is now useless.

title: Absolutely useless and wasting your time
text:
I’m trying to set up a classic 208. After the 15th try in which the app is unable to connect, neither manual nor in anyway else and the units magic glowing button always blinking/glowing in a way the app doesn’t offer as a selection option - I’m giving up. 
How can every cheap China hardware be setup with a button press and a ‘quality product’ drive you nuts just trying?!

title: Disconnects from Wi-Fi
text: I’m having the same problem as many other customers appear to be having. My Healthprotect filter disconnects from Wi-Fi every day or two. Sometimes turning it off and unplugging will fix it. Sometimes I have to delete the app and reinstall it to get the Wi-Fi connected again. Also scheduling doesn’t always work. Very disappointing for such an expensive filter.

title: Not useful
text: I’m not sure why the company made the 405 wifi-capable at all, except for marketing. I was hoping I could get a view of the indoor air quality throughout the day, only to realize the 405 doesn’t actually have a sensor for this.  I’m ditching the app, undecided so far on the unit.

title: Works great and easy to use
text: Connected to my Health Protect 7770i with no issue. Able to control a d set schedule from the app. Love the app and product so far.

title: Trainwreck of an app

title: Doesn’t work
text: So frustrating. It connected with the device for a week and was so cool. I haven’t been able to connect with it since. title: Terrible
text: I give up. These are expensive devices which have central features requiring an app - which simply doesn’t work. It’s absolutely horrible and it’s been like this throughout multiple versions. Is anybody from Blue Air reading these reviews?

title: September 11 update broken
text: Never had any problems with this app until the most recent update which broke connectivity with all three of my devices and now I cannot reconnect them! Please fix this. Troubleshoot button does nothing to assist as it assumes the problem is my Wi-Fi rather than your broken, buggy software.

title: Garbage app

title: App Installation Not for the Faint of Heart
text:
Start with the Blueair device unplugged but physically ready to go. Be extremely patient and observant when setting up the Wifi.
1. Setup account in Blueair.com if you had not done so. Do not use the Blueair app to create the account – go to the Blueair.com directly using your web browser of your choice. Use a strong 
unique password (12 alphanumeric characters minimum with special characters).
2. (Optional) Setup separate wifi network for IoT (Internet of Things) and setup a unique WPA2 password. Ensure you are using 2.4GHz frequency (not 5GHz).
3. Download Blueair app on your smartphone (not tablet or other mobile devices). Sign in with your new Blueair account.
4. Turn on wifi on your smartphone. Make sure you are not running any VPN (Virtual Private Network) and that your wifi is not set for “private address”.
5. Make sure you are on the wifi network where you want the Blueair device to use. Have the wifi password handy and ensure the SSID broadcast is on.
6. Plug in the Blueair device and wait about 2 minutes.
7. Run the Blueair app on your smartphone and follow the instructions. Look at the wifi indicator on the Blueair device very carefully, since the blinking rate can be difficult to interpret.
8. You will then enter the wifi password when prompted in the app.
9. It will error and press the wifi indicator for 4 seconds (count 1001, 1002, etc) to reset to manual mode (when instructed by the app).
10. Connect your smartphone to the CLASSIC-xxxx wifi network (or whatever network the app tells you).
11. Enter the wifi password again in the app when prompted.
12. The Blueair app should then indicate that the setup is complete (it can take up to a minute).
13. At this stage, your Blueair device is now setup in your Blueair account at their cloud service.

Once the above steps are done, you can then setup another mobile device (like a tablet), install the Blueair app, log into your Blueair account, and see you Blueair device. You no longer need to use your smartphone to manage your Blueair device via wifi connection.

Next thing is to set your location (and only have the location active when the app is running) and reset the filter so that the Filter Status is correct. See the FAQ in the Blueair app’s Help, which takes you to the same Blueair.com web site Support page, for more info.

Note that these steps are for Blueair for iOS v3.0,9 (3). Note also that it took me 3 tries to finally get the Blueair device’s wifi and app to work correctly. If you need to reset the Blueair device’s wifi to start over, just press the wifi indicator on the device for 4 seconds, and it should then blink in its “new start” mode.

UPDATE: The app appears to reset the Blueair settings. When you run the app, ensure you double-check the Auto, Filter, and other settings to ensure they are set the way you want them. For some reason, my app keeps putting the Blueair device in Fan mode instead of Auto, and the app forgets that the filter replacement setting was reset. As others commented in the Apple App Store, the Blueair app appears to be unstable.

title: Impressive how horrible the initial experience is
text:
I have to say it’s really impressive that a company selling products that cost as much as a new iPhone are able to make the onboarding experience as incredibly bad as Blueair has.  I just received my new $900 680i and was excited to plug it in and get purifying.  90 minutes later I just hope it lives up to its air cleaning reputation and that I never have to interact with its app ever again.

First issue; in 2020 their devices still can’t utilize a modern WiFi standard or hidden WiFi networks.  It will only work with 2.4ghz networks, the network has to be broadcast, your phone has to be on the same network during setup, you have to give it location access just to add your new device.  Well, I only had 5ghz enabled, and I have a network specific to devices I don’t trust, which my phone is not typically on.  Additionally, iPhones generally prefer 5ghz, so even dual mode is insufficient.  I had to create a new 2.4ghz network (or could have switched my 5ghz to 2.4-only, permanently for this device), and then join my phone to it, just to be able to tell this thing how to connect to WiFi.

Second; didn’t work.  You get stuck at the choose your device screen, or the pre-requisite list screen.  If ANY prior attempt at enrolling the device fails, you’ll never get past this if you do not also power cycle the purifier; they don’t tell you this anywhere, so you end up in an infinite loop of errors and timeouts.

Third; manual setup doesn’t work.  I can join the purifier’s custom-connect WiFi network, but the app refused to recognize I had done so.

Finally, I power cycle it, start over, reconfigure my 2.4-only broadcast-enabled WiFi network, and 90 minutes later I’m able to get the app to actually work and enroll the device.

Considering this a win, I peel the initial setup label off the top of my device, and the sticker they use leaves all the adhesive behind on the unit.  Are you kidding me?  I just spent $900 on an air purifier, and 90 minutes configuring this ridiculous app, and my final interaction is going to be using Goo Gone to scrub adhesive off my product?

title: Beautiful design. Flaky connection
text:
A nice looking and functional app. So why not 5 stars?  The app frequently becomes stuck on status ‘Connecting...’ with a grey background. This occurs after the phone is locked. It’s 100% reproducible every time. 

If anyone else is having this issue, one workaround is to force-close and reopen the app each time. This can be done by double pressing the home button and ‘Swiping up’ on the Blueair app. 

EDIT: Old setup issue below. SOLVED: Seems like the unit doesn’t play nice with virtual wifi networks. After disabling that setting on our home Netgear router, was able to complete the initial setup fine after that. In Blueair’s defence, this specific issue is in fact mentioned in an online support article. 

ORIGINAL REVIEW:

Spent 30 minutes trying to get the new 280i and 480i to work our fam WiFi network. Both using the standard route and via ‘classic-connect’ manual option. 

As an engineer myself the next will try setup a dedicated 2.4ghz network without security. I have no idea why it can’t connect to my network which is just a regular WPA2 802.11n network. 

It seems others here also struggle with WiFi. A suggestion to the dev team : maybe test with wider range of customer routers and setups. Real world conditions in the lab can be far from representative. 

In conclusion we have *many* of other smart IoT devices on the network, from a wide range of manufacturer, all working fine. The issue appears to be BlueAir.
